# Migration Guide Docs

## Application compatibility

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/application-compatibility.md): Learn about application compatibility in .NET Framework and how it's affected by runtime and retargeting changes when migrating to another version.

## Behavior mitigations

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigations.md): Learn more about: Mitigate new behaviors in .NET Framework 4.6 and later
- [Custom IMessageFilter.PreFilterMessage implementations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-custom-imessagefilter-prefiltermessage-implementations.md): Learn about the custom IMessageFilter.PreFilterMessage implementation included in Windows Forms apps that target .NET Framework 4.6.1 and later.
- [Deserialize objects across app domains](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-deserialization-of-objects-across-app-domains.md): Learn how to diagnose and mitigate an issue where an attempt to deserialize objects in the logical call context across app domains throws an exception.
- [New 64-bit JIT compiler](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-new-64-bit-jit-compiler.md): Learn about the new 64-bit JIT compiler included in .NET Framework 4.6 and unexpected behavior or exceptions that might occur during compilation.
- [Path colon checks](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-path-colon-checks.md): Learn about the changes made in .NET Framework 4.6.2 to support checks for the proper drive separator syntax (the colon).
- [Path normalization](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-path-normalization.md): Learn how path normalization in .NET Framework has changed beginning with apps that target .NET Framework 4.6.2.
- [PNG frames in icon objects](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-png-frames-in-icon-objects.md): Learn how to configure the behavior of PNG frames in icon objects if the new behavior included in .NET Framework 4.6 and later is undesirable.
- [Pointer-based touch and stylus support](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-pointer-based-touch-and-stylus-support.md): Learn about the effects of enabling an optional WPF touch/stylus stack for WPF apps that target .NET Framework 4.7.
- [Pool blocking period](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-pool-blocking-period.md): Learn how to mitigate issues caused by the connection pool blocking period being removed for connections to Azure SQL databases.
- [Product versioning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-product-versioning.md): In this article, learn how .NET Framework 4.6 and later product versioning has changed from previous releases.
- [Control character serialization](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-serialization-control-characters.md): Learn about the way control characters serialization has changed to conform to ECMAScript V6 and V8 in .NET Framework 4.7.
- [TLS protocols](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-tls-protocols.md): Learn about the impact and mitigation for the TLS Protocol changes beginning with .NET Framework 4.6.
- [WCF services and certificate auth](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-wcf-services-and-certificate-authentication.md): Learn how to mitigate certificate authentication issues from the changes to the WCF SSL protocol default list in .NET Framework 4.6.
- [WPF layout](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-wpf-layout.md): Learn how to mitigate issues that result from a change in the WPF controls layout, like the placement of an object moving by one pixel.
- [WPF window rendering](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-wpf-window-rendering.md): Learn about the impact and mitigation for WPF window rendering in .NET Framework 4.6 running on Windows 8 or later.
- [X509CertificateClaimSet.FindClaims method](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-x509certificateclaimset-findclaims-method.md): Learn how the X509CertificateClaimSet.FindClaims method has changed for apps that target .NET Framework 4.6.1.
- [XML schema validation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-xml-schema-validation.md): The XSD schema validation detects a violation of the unique constraint if a compound key is used and one key is empty in .NET Framework 4.6.
- [ZipArchiveEntry.FullName path separator](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/mitigation-ziparchiveentry-fullname-path-separator.md): Learn how the path separator for the ZipArchiveEntry.FullName property has changed starting with apps that target .NET Framework 4.6.1.

## Compatibility

- [Version compatibility](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/version-compatibility.md): Learn about compatibility between versions of .NET Framework, including backward compatibility and side-by-side execution.

## Migration guide

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/index.md): A guide for migrating to newer .NET Framework versions that includes resources for new features and application compatibility.
- [Configure an app to support .NET Framework 4 or later](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/how-to-configure-an-app-to-support-net-framework-4-or-4-5.md): Use the included example to learn how to configure your desktop app to support .NET Framework 4 or later.
- [Migrate from .NET Framework 1.1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/migrating-from-the-net-framework-1-1.md): Learn about the steps required to run an application compiled using .NET Framework 1.1 on Windows 7 or later.
- [.NET Framework 4 migration issues](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/net-framework-4-migration-issues.md): Learn about migration issues between .NET Framework 3.5 Service Pack 1 and .NET Framework 4, including fixes and changes for standards compliance and security.
- [Build apps against reference assemblies](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/reference-assemblies.md): Learn how to reference the .NET Framework Reference Assemblies in your project, when you can't install a matching developer pack.

## Children

- [Retargeting](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/retargeting/llms.txt)
- [Runtime](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/migration-guide/runtime/llms.txt)
